quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to create a video element:
[!raw!]
<{0} controls>
     <source {1}="video.mp4" type="video/mp4"/>
     <{2} src="video.ogg" type="video/ogg"/>
      Video not supported
</video>
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Videos in HTML[/h1]

The video element is similar to the audio element. 
You can specify the video source URL using an attribute in a video element, or using source elements inside the video element: [code format="html" codeId="45"][b]<video controls>[/b]
   <source src="video.mp4" type="video/mp4">
   <source src="video.ogg" type="video/ogg">
   Video is not supported by your browser
[b]</video>[/b][/code]
[note]Another aspect that the audio and video elements have in common is that the major browsers do not all support the same file types. If the browser does not support the first video type, it will try the next one.[/note]

quizzes.question: Rearrange the code to create a valid video tag that will attempt to play the mp4 file first.
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Attributes of <video>[/h1]

Another aspect shared by both the audio and the video elements is that each has  [b]controls[/b], [b]autoplay [/b]and [b]loop [/b]attributes. 

In this example, the video will replay after it finishes playing: [code format="html" codeId="46"]<video controls [b]autoplay loop[/b]>
   <source src="video.mp4" type="video/mp4">
   <source src="video.ogg" type="video/ogg">
   Video is not supported by your browser
</video>[/code]
[note]Currently, there are three supported video formats for the <video> element: MP4, WebM, and OGG.[/note]
